systems¶

class DiscreteTimeLib.systems.DiscreteTimeSystem(b, a)¶

Discrete-time system object, implemented as a digital filter.

Parameters b and a are numerator and denominator coefficients for the transfer function of the system.

\[H(z) = \frac{b_0 + b_1 z^{-1} + ... + b_n z^{-n}} {a_0 + a_1 z^{-1} + ... + a_m z^{-m}}\]
Parameters

  • b (array-like) – One-dimensional array-like representing transfer function numerator coefficients.

  • a (array-like) – One-dimensional array-like representing transfer function denominator coefficients.

eval(z)¶

Evaluate filter at given input value.

Parameters

z (numpy.clongdouble) – Given input value.

Returns

val – Conputed output value.

Return type

numpy.clongdouble

filter(sig)¶

Apply digital filter on discrete-time signal.

Parameters

sig (DiscreteTimeSignal) – Given discrete-time signal.

Returns

y_n – Filtered discrete-time signal.

Return type

DiscreteTimeSignal

freqz(w_range, num=50)¶

Compute magnitude frequency response of system.

Parameters

  • w_range (array-like) – Range of angular velocities to compute frequency response for. For e.g. set n_range = [-np.pi, np.pi] to compute from \(\omega = -\pi\) to \(\omega = -\pi\).

  • num (int, optional) – Number of points to divide range into.

Returns

freq_response – Frequency response of system.

Return type

numpy.ndarray

impz(n_range)¶

Compute impulse response of system.

Parameters

n_range (array-like, optional) – Range of indices to compute impulse response for. For e.g. set n_range = [-1, 3] to compute from n = -1 to n = 2 inclusive.

Returns

response – Impulse response signal of system.

Return type

DiscreteTimeSignal

iztrans()¶

Compute inverse z-transform of system.

Returns

  • exp (sympy.core.expr.Expr) – Z-transform of the system, computed as a sympy expression.

  • n (sympy.core.symbol.Symbol) – Symbolic variable used to create sympy expression.
